subject: RE: Seniors Events Media Release
preview: Hi James, Sure, confirming these capacities are all set now and we will add the  General Surgery Event capacity on 23rd March to be 80 whilst creating that page.

full_threads.body:
Hi James, 

Sure, confirming these capacities are all set now and we will add the  General Surgery Event capacity on 23rd March to be 80 whilst creating that page.

Hi Heath ..

Can you make the capacity of the Falls Prevention event 12 people.
Can I also check Heath that the Hydro capacity is set at 8.

Whilst I’m about it .. can we set the General Surgery Event capacity on 23rd March at 80.

THANKS
JAMES



From: Kris Lukjanenko
Sent: Wednesday, 6 February 2019 5:18 PM
To: James Croll <James.Croll@lakeviewprivate.com.au <mailto:James.Croll@lakeviewprivate.com.au>>
Cc: Rosemary McDonald <Rosemary.McDonald@lakeviewprivate.com.au <mailto:Rosemary.McDonald@lakeviewprivate.com.au>>; Sanjay Adusumilli <sadu1@hotmail.com <mailto:sadu1@hotmail.com>>; Nick Romeo <nick.romeo@lakeviewprivate.com.au <mailto:nick.romeo@lakeviewprivate.com.au>>; Elle Zattera <Elle.Zattera@lakeviewprivate.com.au <mailto:Elle.Zattera@lakeviewprivate.com.au>>
Subject: RE: Seniors Events Media Release

Hi James,

I said a lot apparently. That’s all fine.

Originally the plan was for 8 people for the falls prevention due to the size of the area we will be using for exercise. Can I meet you half way and we cap it at 12.
If the hydro and falls prevention develop a waiting list im sure we can sort something out.

Regards

Kris

From: James Croll
Sent: Wednesday, 6 February 2019 4:43 PM
To: Kris Lukjanenko <Kris.Lukjanenko@lakeviewprivate.com.au <mailto:Kris.Lukjanenko@lakeviewprivate.com.au>>
Cc: Rosemary McDonald <Rosemary.McDonald@lakeviewprivate.com.au <mailto:Rosemary.McDonald@lakeviewprivate.com.au>>; Sanjay Adusumilli <sadu1@hotmail.com <mailto:sadu1@hotmail.com>>; Nick Romeo <nick.romeo@lakeviewprivate.com.au <mailto:nick.romeo@lakeviewprivate.com.au>>; Elle Zattera <Elle.Zattera@lakeviewprivate.com.au <mailto:Elle.Zattera@lakeviewprivate.com.au>>
Subject: Seniors Events Media Release
Importance: High

Kris … I’m about to send the following to the Hills Shire Times. Hopefully they’ll publish it.
Are you happy with the quotes I’ve attributed to you?

I’ll also send it to the surrounding Retirement Homes, Hills Shire Mums and Castle Hill RSL’s.

If anyone has other ideas for distribution .. let me know!

JAMES




MEDIA RELEASE


Lakeview Private Hospital announce special events for
Hills Shire Seniors






To coincide with the Hills Shire Seniors Week, Lakeview Private Hospital is running two very special events for seniors –
a Falls Prevention morning and a Treating Arthritis with Hydrotherapy afternoon. Both events are free and both will
take place in the hospitals state-of-the-art rehabilitation facility – Lakeview Rehabilitation.

“We are only too happy to support the local senior’s community during this very special week,” said Kris Lukjanenko,
Manager of Lakeview Rehabilitation. “We will be delighted to welcome not just seniors themselves but everyone involved
in their care to our unique facility so they can see at first hand the benefits it provides for the community.”

“Since we were established, Lakeview Rehabilitation has gained an unrivalled reputation as one of the most advanced
rehabilitation facilities in Australia,” continues Lukjanenko. “We not only have the latest in rehabilitation equipment,
a gymnasium that is truly state-of-the-art, an excellent hydrotherapy pool and spa, but a team of outstanding and compassionate
rehabilitation specialists who have been hand-picked and are committed to delivering the best possible care.”

The Falls Prevention event will take place on the morning of Wednesday, 20th February 2019 and is limited to 16 attendees.
“The morning is essential for those who suffer from falling over (or have concerns about the risk) and for those who care for them,”
explains Lukjanenko. “The morning will be hosted by our excellent Physiotherapists and Occupational Therapists who will talk
attendees through essential things to be aware of both at home and in residential care facilities. Talks will cover advice on
ideal equipment that one should have access to, how life both at home and at one’s care facility can be simplified, as well as advice
on exercises to reduce risks. We’ll also be including a participation class where attendees can try some simple standing exercises.”

There will be two Treating Arthritis with Hydrotherapy events meanwhile which will take place on the afternoons of
Tuesday, 19th and Thursday, 21st February respectively.

“We have one of the finest hydrotherapy pools in the Southern Hemisphere here at Lakeview,” explains Lukjanenko, “and the
benefits it can have on treating arthritis are quite extraordinary. We’ve designed the afternoons so that our Physiotherapists
can show how hydrotherapy exercise can greatly reduce stress on the affected joints, improve the physical functioning of affected
joints, and stimulate the immune system. We’ll also be including talks on the best exercises for specific conditions.
Attendees will then be able to take to the pool to experience the benefits at first hand.”

Complimentary morning or afternoon tea will be included after the events when attendees can get to know the wonderful Lakeview
Private Hospital team who will also take them on a tour of the state-of-the-art facility including its specialist gym and hydrotherapy
pool, and spa.

The Falls Prevention morning takes place on Wednesday, 20th February 2019 from 11:00am to 12:30pm. The event is limited
to 16 people.
The Treating Arthritis with Hydrotherapy events meanwhile take place on Tuesday, 19th and Thursday, 21st February from 2:30pm
to 4:00pm each day. Each afternoon is limited to 8 attendees.

Both events are free and take place at Lakeview Private Hospital, 17-19 Solent Circuit, Norwest,
For further details and to book call (02) 8711 0247 <tel:(02)%208711%200247> or visit www.lakeviewprivate.com.au <http://www.lakeviewprivate.com.au/>

Further information:



Attached images:

· Lakeview Rehabilitation Hydrotherapy Pool and Spa
· Lakeview Rehabilitation Gymnasium
· Lakeview Private Hospital overlooking Norwest Lake
